document_data.name: Malakar Surth
document_data.mainbody: '''Malakar Surth''' was a merchant from [[Marsember]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Malakar Surth sounded sour and sarcastic, often speaking with a thin voice. He was a lean, tall man. His face was hard and thin.
document_data.Personality: Malakar was a sarcastic, insensitive man with a superior attitude and a cruel, sadistic streak.
document_data.Possessions:
Malakar and Bezrar both had Marsemban long knifes, often used for gutting fish, but also for combat.

Of note, Malakar Surth owned a coach, stables, and two dapple gray draft horses. His house was very private, and contained numerous traps.
document_data.Activities: Malakar dealt in alcohol, drugs, perfumes, and poisons, often with spell-wielding outlanders.
document_data.Relationships:
[[Aumun Tholant Bezrar]] and Malakar Surth were known to have worked together, and it was believed by [[Durexter Dagohnlar]] that Malakar was the leader, while Bezrar was not as bold without him. Malakar knew that Aumun was infatuated with a dancer at [[the Amorous Anchor]].

Malakar Surth had recently come to be associated with a [[Red Wizard]] of [[Thay]], [[Harnrim Starangh]]. He also appeared to be aware of someone known as [[Ponczer]] at [[the Firehelm]].
